practice_content.instructions: Practice Spanish relative pronouns with these exercises.

prompts.question: Which relative pronoun means 'that/who/which'?
prompts.explanation: 'Que' is the most common relative pronoun

prompts.question: Which relative pronoun means 'who' (after prepositions)?
prompts.explanation: 'Quien' is used for people after prepositions

prompts.question: Complete: 'El libro _____ leo' (The book that I read)
prompts.explanation: 'Que' connects the clauses about the book

prompts.question: Complete: 'La persona con _____ hablo' (The person with whom I speak)
Complete: 'La casa _____ vivo' (The house where I live)
Which is more formal: 'el cual' or 'que'?
Complete: 'El día _____ llegué' (The day when I arrived)
prompts.explanation: 'Que' can also mean 'when' in relative clauses

prompts.question: Which relative pronoun agrees in gender and number?
prompts.explanation: 'El cual' changes: el cual, la cual, los cuales, las cuales

exercises.instructions: Complete with the correct relative pronoun

prompts.sentence: El estudiante _____ estudia mucho saca buenas notas. (The student who studies a lot gets good grades.)
prompts.explanation: 'Que' is used for people as subjects

prompts.sentence: La película _____ vimos ayer fue excelente. (The movie that we saw yesterday was excellent.)
La chica con _____ bailo es mi novia. (The girl with whom I dance is my girlfriend.)
El restaurante _____ comemos es muy bueno. (The restaurant where we eat is very good.)
Los amigos de _____ te hablé vienen mañana. (The friends about whom I told you are coming tomorrow.)
El coche _____ compré es rojo. (The car that I bought is red.)
prompts.explanation: 'Que' is the most common relative pronoun

prompts.sentence: La ciudad _____ nací es pequeña. (The city where I was born is small.)
El profesor para _____ trabajo es muy exigente. (The professor for whom I work is very demanding.)
Los libros _____ leemos son interesantes. (The books that we read are interesting.)
El momento _____ llegaste fue perfecto. (The moment when you arrived was perfect.)
